# redo()

**Instance Method**

Performs the operations in the last group on the redo stack, if there are any, recording them on the undo stack as a single group.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func redo()
```

## Discussion

Raises an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSExceptionName/internalInconsistencyException] if the method is invoked during an undo operation.

This method posts an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerCheckpoint] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerWillRedoChange] before it performs the redo operation, and it posts the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerDidRedoChange] after it performs the redo operation.

## Related Documentation

- **registerUndo(withTarget:selector:object:)**: Registers the selector of the specified target to implement a single undo operation that the target receives.

## Performing undo and redo

- **undo()**: Closes the top-level undo group if necessary, and then performs undo operations on the group.
- **undoNestedGroup()**: Performs the undo operations in the last undo group (whether top-level or nested), recording the operations on the redo stack as a single group.
